user.speaker: user
user.text: Following an investment guru a good idea?

agent.speaker: agent
agent.text: Following an investment guru can be a good idea if you can afford the time and are looking for more in-depth, fun investment tips. However, it's crucial to understand what you're investing in, including the company's products, and to buy stock in good companies at good prices, considering factors like price to earnings, price to revenue, and price to book. Therefore, while following an investment guru can provide valuable insights, it's essential to conduct your own research and make informed decisions based on your understanding and investment goals. Blindly following other investors, including big investors or gurus, is not recommended, as their strategies may differ from yours. Instead, consider finding someone with similar goals to help guide your investment decisions.

contexts.text: If it's money you can lose, and you're young, why not?  Another would be motifinvesting where you can invest in ideas as opposed to picking companies. However, blindly following other investors is not a good idea.  Big investors strategies might not be similar to yours, they might be looking for something different than you.  If you're going to do that, find someone with similar goals. Having investments, and a strategy, that you believe in and understand is paramount to investing.  It's that belief, strategy, and understanding that will give you direction.  Otherwise you're just going to follow the herd and as they say, sheep get slaughtered.

ml.tokens.model_text: |user|: Following an investment guru a good idea?

contexts.text: "If you can afford the time and are looking for more deep, and fun, investment tips, check out http://gurufocus.com. Great for more fundamental analysis of ""Intelligent Investor"" type Benjamin Graham-style businesses.  No use scatter-shooting the stock exchange hoping to find good value businesses. Even blue-chips have an increasingly uncertain future (except IMHO certain world dominators like KO, WMT, XO and MCD)."

ml.tokens.model_text: |user|: Following an investment guru a good idea?

contexts.text: The key to good investing is you need to understand what you are investing in. That is, if you are buying a company that makes product X, you need to understand that. It is a good idea to buy stock in good companies but that is not sufficient. You need to buy stock in good companies at good prices. That means you need to understand things like price to earnings, price to revenue and price to book. Bob

ml.tokens.model_text: |user|: Following an investment guru a good idea?

agent.original_text: According to the documents, following an investment guru can be a good idea if you can afford the time and are looking for more in-depth, fun investment tips. However, it's important to remember that even blue-chip companies have an increasingly uncertain future. Additionally, it's crucial to understand what you're investing in, including the company's products, and to buy stock in good companies at good prices, considering factors like price to earnings, price to revenue, and price to book. Therefore, while following an investment guru can provide valuable insights, it's essential to conduct your own research and make informed decisions based on your understanding and investment goals. Blindly following other investors, including big investors or gurus, is not recommended, as their strategies may differ from yours. Instead, consider finding someone with similar goals to help guide your investment decisions.
